thread.title: Lincoln International Bolsters Med-Tech and Life Sciences Expertise

author: cnbc.com
title: Lincoln International Bolsters Med-Tech and Life Sciences Expertise
text:
SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 22, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- Lincoln International, a leading global, mid-market investment bank, is pleased to announce the addition of Brian Bock to the firm in San Francisco. Brian will serve as a key member of the firm's Healthcare Group having extensive expertise in the medical technology (med-tech) and life sciences sectors. He brings to Lincoln significant transaction execution experience and deep sector expertise.
"These are transformative times for the Healthcare sector. Demographic changes, innovation and regulatory shifts are driving strong mergers and acquisition activity," said Rob Brown, CEO North America & Managing Director at Lincoln International. "Brian's expertise on the leading edge of med-tech and life sciences will be instrumental in continuing to capitalize on that rising M&A demand. He brings deep experience and knowledge to advise growth-oriented companies and investors in two rapidly advancing areas of Healthcare. Moreover, he joins our recently opened San Francisco office, strengthening our presence in that market which is a key hub for investors in this space. We are thrilled to welcome him to Lincoln."
Brian brings to Lincoln more than 20 years of investment banking and merger and acquisition experience working in partnership with early to late stage clients, venture capital, private equity and growth equity firms on numerous types of corporate finance and merger and acquisition assignments. Brian's M&A advisory experience includes successful engagements for both private and public companies, U.S. domestic and cross-border transactions, reverse mergers, divestitures and special situation assignments across all segments of healthcare.
Prior to joining Lincoln International, Brian was a Managing Director in JMP Securities' ("JMP") healthcare investment banking group where he was a key contributor in establishing the firm's healthcare practice. Before JMP, Brian was in the healthcare investment banking group at RBC Capital Markets focusing on the life sciences sector.
"I am truly excited about the opportunity to add to Lincoln's impressive momentum in the healthcare industry, and, more particularly, to accelerate the firm's focus on the fields of medical technology and life sciences," stated Brian. "In the wake of a consolidation among large cap players in the U.S. and a growing demand for healthcare in emerging markets, the unique capability to provide mid-market clients with the highest-level of service on a global scale was a key differentiator of Lincoln and an attractive factor in deciding to join the team."
Co-Head of North American Healthcare Group, Barry Freeman, stated, "Brian greatly strengthens Lincoln International's capabilities in the healthcare industry. With his deep relationships and strong track record of successful transactions in the med-tech and life sciences sectors, Brian's expertise enhances not only Lincoln's Healthcare Group, but also the firm's Technology, Media & Telecom Group."
About Lincoln International
Lincoln International specializes in merger and acquisition advisory services, debt advisory services, private capital raising and restructuring advice on mid-market transactions. Lincoln International also provides fairness opinions, valuations and joint venture and partnering advisory services on a wide range of transaction sizes. With nineteen offices in the Americas, Asia and Europe, Lincoln International has strong local knowledge and contacts in key global economies. The firm provides clients with senior-level attention, in-depth industry expertise and integrated resources. By being focused and independent, Lincoln International serves its clients without conflicts of interest.
More information about Lincoln International can be obtained at www.lincolninternational.com
